content.text:
# List of international trips made by Yvette Cooper as Foreign Secretary of the United Kingdom

]]
This is a list of international visits undertaken by Yvette Cooper (in office from September 2025) while serving as the Foreign Secretary. The list includes both private travel and official visits. The list includes only foreign travel which the Foreign Secretary made during her tenure.
Summary
Cooper has visited 5 countries thus far during her tenure as Foreign Secretary. The number of visits per country where Secretary Cooper has traveled are:
* One visit to Belgium, Ukraine, the Vatican City and the United States
* Two visits to France
Table
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|+
!
! scope=col | Country
! scope=col | Locations
! scope=col | Dates
! scope=col | Details
|-
| 1
|
|Kyiv
| 12 September 2025
| Announced £142 million in UK aid. Met with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha and Prime Minister Yulia Svyrydenko.
|-
| 2
|
|New York City
| 22–25 September 2025
| Attended the 80th United Nations General Assembly and met with other G7 Foreign Ministers.
|-
| rowspan=2|3
|
|Paris
| 6 October 2025
| Met with French Minister for Europe and Foreign Affairs Jean-Noël Barrot.
|-
|
|Brussels
| 6 October 2025
| Met with the Secretary General of NATO Mark Rutte and Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prévot.
|-
| 4
|
|Paris
| 9–10 October 2025
| Attended a ministerial meeting on the Gaza war peace plan.
|-
| 5
|
|Vatican City
| 22–23 October 2025
| Accompanied Their Majesties The King and Queen on their State visit to the Holy See. Gave a reading at a special ecumenical service in the Sistine Chapel.
|}
